OJJDP NATIONAL GIRLS INSTITUTE (NGI)TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE

NATIONAL CRITTENTON AND THE OJJDP GIRLS TTA TEAM UNDERSTANDS THE GOAL OF REDUCING RISK FOR GIRLS IN THE JUVENILE JUSTICE SYSTEM IS TO REDUCE RISK FACTORS AND PROMOTE PROTECTIVE FACTORS FOR GIRLS WHO COME IN CONTACT WITH THE JUVENILE JUSTICE SYSTEM, AND PLACE THEM ON A PATH TOWARD SUCCESS, STABILITY, AND LONG-TERM CONTRIBUTION TO SOCIETY. TO ACHIEVE THIS GOAL, THE OJJDP GIRLS TTA TEAM’S OBJECTIVES ARE TO: 1. EXPAND THE SKILLS OF PROGRAM PROVIDERS AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS WORKING WITH THE TARGET POPULATION OF GIRLS IN THE JUVENILE JUSTICE SYSTEM; 2. ASSIST PROGRAM PROVIDERS WITH IMPROVING JUVENILE JUSTICE SYSTEM RESPONSES FOR GIRLS IN CONTACT WITH THE SYSTEM. NATIONAL CRITTENTON (NC) LEAD APPLICANT, THE NATIONAL COUNCIL OF JUVENILE AND FAMILY COURT JUDGES (NCJFCJ) SUBRECIPIENT, THE ASSESSMENT TEAM AND THE CORE CONSULTANTS OF GIRL EXPERTS ARE THE PROVIDERS OF TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. ADDITIONAL EXPERTS OUTSIDE OF THE CORE CONSULTANTS WILL BE ENGAGED AS APPROPRIATE BASED ON TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE NEEDS. OJJDP GIRLS TTA ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE THE DEVELOPMENT OF CUSTOMIZED GIRLS TTA PLANS FOR CATEGORY 1 PROJECT SITES FOR THE PROVISION OF VIRTUAL AND IN-PERSON TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE; DEVELOPMENT AND DISSEMINATION OF RESOURCES ON GIRLS; AND OTHER FORMS OF TTA SUCH AS PEER-TO-PEER LEARNING, WEBINARS, ETC.

THE UNIVERSITY OF ALABAMA, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE ALABAMA DEPARTMENT OF YOUTH SERVICES (DYS) WHICH OVERSEES THE WORKING ON WOMANHOOD PROGRAM (WOW) AT THE GIRLS INTENSIVE EDUCATION AND TREATMENT FACILITY IN TUSCALOOSA, ALABAMA PROPOSE TO FOCUS ON EDUCATIONAL PROTECTIVE FACTORS. THE THREE YEAR PROJECT WILL PROVIDE EXPLICIT AND INDIVIDUALIZED READING COMPREHENSION AND WRITING STRATEGY INSTRUCTION FOR 108 GIRLS AGES 12-18 USING THE EVIDENCE-BASED SELF-REGULATED STRATEGY DEVELOPMENT APPROACH (U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION). THE OBJECTIVE IS TO IMPROVE THE ACADEMIC, SELF-DETERMINATION, AND BEHAVIORAL PROTECTIVE FACTORS OF GIRLS IN A SECURE JUVENILE JUSTICE SETTING THROUGH READING/WRITING WITH INTEGRATED SELF-DETERMINATION STRATEGY INSTRUCTION AND WITH INTENSIFICATIONS, IF NEEDED; TO INCREASE GIRL VOICE THROUGH REINFORCEMENT OF THEIR SELF-DETERMINATION SKILLS; AND TO PROVIDE FACILITY STAFF WITH INSTRUCTION PROTOCOLS FOR SUSTAINED USE.

NORTHEAST WASHINGTON EDUCATIONAL SERVICE DISTRICT (NEWESD) 101, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH MARTIN HALL JUVENILE DETENTION FACILITY AND SPOKANE COUNTY JUVENILE COURT SERVICES, PROPOSE TO SERVE 100 GIRLS PER YEAR, 17-UNDER, WHO ARE IN, OR ARE AT-RISK OF FALLING INTO, THE JUVENILE JUSTICE SYSTEM BY 1) DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING DIRECT SERVICE PROGRAMS FOR GIRLS INVOLVED IN THE JUVENILE JUSTICE SYSTEM TO REDUCE RECIDIVISM; 2) ENHANCING OR EXPANDING EXISTING PREVENTION AND EARLY INTERVENTION PROGRAMS TO MEET THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF GIRLS INVOLVED IN THE JUVENILE JUSTICE SYSTEM AND 3) DEVELOPING, EXPANDING OR ENHANCING TARGETED CURRICULA FOR STAFF (I.E., PROBATION, DETENTION CENTER STAFF, LAW ENFORCEMENT, JUDGES) TO ENSURE THEY HAVE THE SKILLS NECESSARY TO IMPLEMENT THESE PROGRAMS FOR GIRLS IN THE JUVENILE JUSTICE SYSTEM.

THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROJECT DESCRIBES TWO GOALS TO REDUCE NEW YORK CITY (NYC) GIRLS’ RISK AND INCREASE PROTECTIVE FACTORS, WITH A FOCUS ON REDUCING JUVENILE JUSTICE SYSTEM (JJS) INVOLVEMENT AND ENHANCING GIRLS’ SELF-DETERMINED NEEDS AND STRENGTHS. THE FIRST GOAL IS TO WILL BE TO IDENTIFY 125 JJS-INVOLVED GIRLS BY INTERVENTION AND FAMILY COURTS TO DELIVER ADVOCACY THROUGH THE EVIDENCE-BASED INTERVENTION MODEL, ROSES (RESILIENCE, OPPORTUNITY, SAFETY, EDUCATION, AND STRENGTH). THE SECOND GOAL IS TO DEVELOP ROSES AS A SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITY-BASED ALTERNATIVE FOR JJS-INVOLVED GIRLS IN NYC BEYOND THE FUNDING PERIOD SO THAT THIS CRITICAL RESOURCE FOR REDUCING GIRLS’ RISK REMAINS IN NYC.

THE PROPOSED DOUGLAS COUNTY STRATEGIC INTERVENTIONS NEEDED FOR GIRLS INITIATIVE (DC-SING) WILL (1) EXPAND PROJECT HARMONY’S ANTI-TRAFFICKING YOUTH SERVICES (ATYS) PROGRAM THROUGH THE ADDITION OF A TREATMENT TEAM; (2) ADMINISTER EVIDENCE-BASED ASSESSMENTS TO IDENTIFY THE RISKS AND NEEDS OF SYSTEM-INVOLVED MAR/T GIRLS AT THEIR FIRST POINT OF LAW ENFORCEMENT CONTACT; (3) USE LICENSED MENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONALS TO PROVIDE TRAUMA-INFORMED CARE TO MAR/T GIRLS AND THEIR FAMILIES; (4) ASSIGN A POSITIVE YOUTH DEVELOPMENT ALLY TO PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS TO CONNECT MAR/T GIRLS TO COMMUNITY-BASED INTERVENTION PROGRAMS BASED ON THEIR SPECIFIC RISKS AND NEEDS; AND (5) PROVIDE TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES TO THE ATYS TREATMENT TEAM TO HIGHLIGHT THE LATEST RESEARCH RELATED TO BEST PRACTICES AND TO ENCOURAGE CONTINUED PROFESSIONAL GROWTH AND DEVELOPMENT.

ADULT FRIENDS FOR YOUTH (AFY), IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE HONOLULU POLICE DEPARTMENT, PROPOSE AN EARLY MOBILE ASSESSMENT CENTER (MAC) INTERVENTION PROGRAM, THAT DIVERTS STATUS OFFENDING YOUTH AGES 8-17, FROM ENTERING THE JUVENILE JUSTICE SYSTEM COURT PROCESS. THE GIRLS DIVERSION PROJECT WILL SPECIFICALLY TARGET FEMALE YOUTH FROM HPD DISTRICT 8 WITH THE GOAL OF SERVING BETWEEN 100-150 FEMALE YOUTH BY THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR PERIOD. THE FOUNDATION OF THE MAC, AND AFY IS RE-DIRECTIONAL THERAPY (RT) WHICH INCLUDES TRAUMA-INFORMED CARE, RESTORATIVE JUSTICE, AND A SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT CURRICULUM THAT IS AIMED AT IMPROVING COPING SKILLS THAT INVOLVE YOUTH RECOGNIZING PAST ACTIONS/BEHAVIORS, ASSESSING CONSEQUENCES TO ACTIONS, REGULATING EMOTIONS, AND ESTABLISHING POSITIVE RELATIONSHIPS WITH PEOPLE AROUND THEM.

THE GIRLS EMPOWERMENT NETWORK, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE EXCELLENCE AND ADVANCEMENT FOUNDATION AND THE RON JACKSON STATE JUVENILE CORRECTIONAL COMPLEX IN BROWNWOOD, TEXAS PROPOSE TO BUILD ON EXISTING BEST PRACTICES FROM THE GIRLS EMPOWERMENT NETWORK GIRL CONNECT PROGRAM TO PILOT AN ENHANCED ONLINE PROGRAM, GIRL CONNECT FOR JUVENILE JUSTICE INVOLVED ADOLESCENTS, THAT FOCUSES ON REDUCING RECIDIVISM THROUGH STRESS MANAGEMENT, GROWTH MINDSET, FAILURE AND RESILIENCY, COMMUNICATION, AND HEALTHY FRIENDSHIPS.  THE INITIAL POPULATION WILL BE GIRLS BETWEEN THE AGE OF 10-19 AT RON JACKSON STATE JUVENILE CORRECTIONAL COMPLEX IN BROWNWOOD, TEXAS. THE PROJECTED GOAL IS TO REACH AT LEAST 200 JUVENILE JUSTICE INVOLVED ADOLESCENT GIRL ACROSS A 36-MONTH PERIOD.
